info.title: Swift Api
info.description:
An API for accessing Swift Employment Solution.

All requests made to this API must include the following headers:

    Date: $currentdate
    Authentication: hmac $username:$noncetoken:$digest

Additionally, if you are making a POST/PUT request, you must include the following headers:

    Content-Type: application/json
    Content-Length: length($data)

Where the variables are defined as follows:

    $data: The JSON-encoded array containing your request. See the documentation below for the format this should take.
    
    $currentdate: The current date and time in the following format 'Mon, 12 Mar 2018 13:04:24 GMT’.
    
    $username: Your username for the API service, as supplied by Swift.
    
    $password: Your password for the API service, as supplied by Swift.
    
    $method: The method you are using to submit this request(GET/POST/PUT)
    
    $URL: The URL you are sending this request to (e.g. http://api.swiftemployment.co.uk/v2/user/JD1000)
    
    $noncetoken: The token supplied to you after making a GET call to /token/. If you are making a request to receive a token, use the value ‘1’ in here.
    
    $requestinfo: A string to be hashed for authentication, composed like: '$method+$url+$currentdate+$noncetoken' including the +’s.
    
    $digest: A hash to authenticate your request. Created as follows:
    Use a hmac hashing function (such as http://php.net/manual/en/function.hash-hmac.php) to create your hash, using the SHA512 algorithm, $requestinfo as the data to be encoded and $password as the encyption key.
    Take the output of the above function and Base64 encode it.

get.description: Returns a list of users. If no search parameters are provided, returns all users.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of a user to search against

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of a user to search against

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email of a user to search against

get.description: Returns a list of timesheets. If no search parameters are provided, returns all timesheets.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: The reference of a timesheet to search for

parameters.name: grossgreater
parameters.description: Search for timesheets where the gross value is greater than this number

parameters.name: grossless
parameters.description: Search for timesheets where the gross value is less than this number

parameters.name: netgreater
parameters.description: Search for timesheets where the net value is greater than this number

parameters.name: netless
parameters.description: Search for timesheets where the net value is less than this number

parameters.name: sentbefore
parameters.description: Search for timesheets where payment was sent before this date (DD/MM/YYYY)

parameters.name: sentafter
parameters.description: Search for timesheets where payment was sent after this date (DD/MM/YYYY)

parameters.name: receivedbefore
parameters.description: Search for timesheets where payment was received before this date (DD/MM/YYYY)

parameters.name: receivedafter
parameters.description: Search for timesheets where payment was received after this date (DD/MM/YYYY)

parameters.name: approvedbefore
parameters.description: Search for timesheets which were approved before this date (DD/MM/YYYY)

parameters.name: approvedafter
parameters.description: Search for timesheets which were approved after this date (DD/MM/YYYY)

200.description: The client_invoice_ref for the approved timesheets

get.description: Fetch a specific timesheet as a PDF

parameters.name: timesheet_ref
parameters.description: The reference of the timesheet

200.description: A specific timesheet as a PDF

get.description: Returns a list of all client invoices
Fetch a specific client invoice details

parameters.name: client_invoice_ref
parameters.description: The reference of the invoice

200.description: A specific client invoice as a pdf

UserPut.description: A JSON object containing information on clients to add/remove from a user

user_ref.description: The reference of the user (max 10 chars)

add_client_ref.description: An array containing the references of clients (max 10 chars) you wish to add to this user

delete_client_ref.description: An array containing the references of clients (max 10 chars) you wish to remove from this user

UserPost.description: A JSON object containing user information

user_ref.description: A reference to describe the user - when creating a user, if one is not provided, it will be generated automatically (max 10 chars)

password.description: A password for the user (min 6 characters)

ni_number.description: The users national insurance number (exactly 9 characters)

address_1.description: First line of the users address (max 40 chars)

address_2.description: Second line of the users address (max 40 chars)

bank_name.description: The name of the bank the users uses (max 30 chars)

bank_account_name.description: The name on the bank account (max 18 chars)

bank_sort_code.description: The bank sort code (6 digits) do not include hyphens

client_ref.description: An array of client_ref's (max 10 chars) to be added to this user

UserResponse.description: A JSON object containing user information

user_ref.description: A reference to describe the user (max 10 chars)

password.description: A password for the user (min 6 characters)

ni_number.description: The users national insurance number (exactly 9 characters)

address_1.description: First line of the users address (max 40 chars)

address_2.description: Second line of the users address (max 40 chars)

bank_name.description: The name of the bank the users uses (max 30 chars)

bank_account_name.description: The name on the bank account (max 18 chars)

bank_sort_code.description: The bank sort code (6 digits) do not include hyphens

clients.description: An array of clients associated with this user

timesheets.description: An array of timesheets associated with this user

ClientPut.description: A JSON object containing client information

client_ref.description: A reference to describe the client (max 10 chars)

address_1.description: First line of the clients address (max 40 chars)

address_2.description: Second line of the clients address (max 40 chars)

contact_name.description: The name of the contact for the client (max 40 chars)

contact_phone.description: The phone number of the contact for the client (max 20 digits)

contact_email.description: The email of the contact for the client (max 40 chars)

contact_fax.description: The fax number of the contact for the client (max 20 digits)

payroll_contact_name.description: The name of the payroll contact for the client (max 40 chars)

payroll_contact_phone.description: The phone number of the payroll contact for the client (max 20 digits)

payroll_contact_email.description: The email of the payroll contact for the client (max 40 chars)

payroll_contact_fax.description: The phone number of the payroll contact for the client (max 20 digits)

TimesheetPut.description: A JSON object containing an array of timesheet_ref's to approve

TimesheetPost.description: A JSON object containing details of a timesheet

user_ref.description: A reference to describe the user (max 10 chars)

total_paid_hours.description: The total number of paid hours in this timesheet (float 7,2)

client_ref.description: A reference to describe the client (max 10 chars)

hours.description: The number of hours worked at normal rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime.description: The number of hours worked at overtime rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime_2.description: The number of hours worked at overtime rate 2 in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime_3.description: The number of hours worked at overtime rate 3 in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime_4.description: The number of hours worked at overtime rate 4 in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime_5.description: The number of hours worked at overtime rate 5 in this timesheet (float 7,2)

half_days.description: The number of hours worked at halfday rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

rate.description: The normal pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime_rate.description: The overtime pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime_rate_2.description: The overtime 2 pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime_rate_3.description: The overtime 3 pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime_rate_4.description: The overtime 4 pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

overtime_rate_5.description: The overtime 5 pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

half_day_rate.description: The halfday pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

client_rate.description: The normal client pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

client_overtime_rate.description: The overtime client pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

client_overtime_rate_2.description: The overtime 2 client pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

client_overtime_rate_3.description: The overtime 3 client pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

client_overtime_rate_4.description: The overtime 4 client pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

client_overtime_rate_5.description: The overtime 5 client pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

client_half_day_rate.description: The halfday client pay rate in this timesheet (float 7,2)

notes.example: This is a timesheet for work done by our very fine worker felicity on behalf of our client Woodward School. Note that work was interrupted on the 2nd day, but she should still receive full pay.

user_ref.description: The reference for the user associated with this timesheet

client_ref.description: The reference for the client associated with this timesheet

net_due.description: The net amount due for this timesheet

gross_val.description: The gross amount due for this timesheet

time_approved.description: The timestamp of when this timesheet was approved

time_payment_sent.description: The timestamp of when payment for this timesheet was sent

time_received_payment.description: The timestamp of when payment for this timesheet was received
